reviewText: I have been studying, collecting and acquiring books, DVDs, and even PC games pertaining to the Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress for the last 3 months or so and I discovered at Amazon this Roaring Glory Warbirds edition dedicated to this iconic, World War Two bomber! I had to purchase this and add it to my collection! I have many of the other Roaring Glory Warbirds DVDs on various WWII fighters (my favorite being Roaring Glory Warbirds, Vol. 3: Vought F4U Corsair) and previously obtained through Amazon the edition dedicated to the TBM Avenger divebomber Roaring Glory Warbirds, Vol. 4: Grumman TBM Avenger. This video, like others in the series, lets the viewer get up close and personal with the aircraft; you see it prepare for flight, start it's engines, taxi down the airstrip, takeoff, fly and land. There is a reenactment by a bomber crew that helps to "flesh out" the Flying Fortress experience and archival film footage (Memphis Belle's story The Memphis Belle (1944)) is utilized. Other DVD features include a printable color Photo Album Slideshow (the B-17 named "Fuddy Duddy" with the "crew" in flight over Geneseo, New York countryside) and a Fact sheet covering the History, Specs, Engine, Details and Armament. I enjoyed this DVD, I found it to be informative, and I would recommend it to anyone with an interest in WWII bombers. I have a Listmania List devoted to the Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress that you can access here at Amazon to see other great resources! The movie "Memphis Belle" uses actual B-17s. Memphis Belle
